name: Matrix44Operations
comment: Static methods operating on 4x4 matrices packed column major into a Float32List.

determinant.name: determinant
determinant.comment: Compute the determinant of the 4x4 vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.determinant.matrix starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.determinant.offset.

determinant33.name: determinant33
determinant33.comment: Compute the determinant of the upper 3x3 of the 4x4 vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.determinant33.matrix starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.determinant33.offset.

inverse.name: inverse
inverse.comment: Compute the inverse of the 4x4 vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.inverse.matrix starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.inverse.offset.

inverse33.name: inverse33
inverse33.comment: Compute the inverse of the upper 3x3 of the 4x4 vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.inverse33.matrix starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.inverse33.offset.

orthoInverse.name: orthoInverse
orthoInverse.comment: Perform a 4x4 transformation matrix inverse. Assumes the upper 3x3 is orthonormal (i.e. does not contain any scale).

normalize33.name: normalize33
normalize33.comment: Normalize the upper 3x3 of the 4x4 vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.normalize33.matrix starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.normalize33.offset.

transform4.name: transform4
transform4.comment: Transform the 4D vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform4.vector starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform4.vectorOffset by the 4x4 vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform4.matrix starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform4.matrixOffset. Store result in vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform4.out starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform4.outOffset.

transform3.name: transform3
transform3.comment: Transform the 3D vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform3.vector starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform3.vectorOffset by the 4x4 vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform3.matrix starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform3.matrixOffset. Store result in vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform3.out starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transform3.outOffset.

transpose33.name: transpose33
transpose33.comment: Transpose the upper 3x3 of the 4x4 vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transpose33.matrix starting at vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.transpose33.offset.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of vector_math/vector_math_operations.Matrix44Operations.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
